weapons_desc.auto_rifle: A heavy rifle fitted with an ammo drum, and used for medium-range fire support.
weapons_desc.beam_pistol: Military-grade heavy-energy pistol with a tightly focused beam.
weapons_desc.blade: Sturdy, light-weight fencing or slashing blade, favored for boarding actions.
weapons_desc.blast_pistol: Projects a bolt of searing energy which detonates on impact. Dissipation is rapid, giving the weapon limited range.
weapons_desc.blast_rifle: Rifle or carbine energy bolt weapon. Signifies that the user means business.
weapons_desc.boarding_saber: A heavy but carefully balanced sword. Often fitted with hand guards.
weapons_desc.brutal_melee_weapon: A heavy, unpleasant looking weapon for smashing and breaking things… or people.
weapons_desc.cling_fire_pistol: Side arm firing a spray of sticky, burning chemicals.
weapons_desc.colony_rifle: Standard-type defensive rifle, popular with colonists and frontier folk. Simple to maintain. Typically semi-automatic.
weapons_desc.dazzle_grenade: Shock charge emitting a loud flash and deafening sound.
weapons_desc.dueling_pistol: Custom-made pistol built for careful aiming. Popular with the fabulously wealthy or old-fashioned.
weapons_desc.flak_gun: Powerful military shotgun, designed for boarding operations and bug hunts in close quarters.
weapons_desc.frakk_grenade: Explosive charge surrounded by a metal casing. Often improvised.
weapons_desc.fury_rifle: High-powered beam weapon modified from military anti-tank designs. Slow build-up before discharge.
weapons_desc.glare_sword: Elegant fencing weapon. The blade is encased in a disruptive energy field, allowing it to cut with great precision.
weapons_desc.hand_cannon: Heavy pistol in a massive caliber. Appreciated by bug hunters.
weapons_desc.hand_flamer: Portable flame-throwing device with a broad focus for area effect.
weapons_desc.hand_gun: Conventional semi-automatic pistol in a medium caliber.
weapons_desc.hand_laser: Portable energy-based pistol. Popular due to ease of use and lack of recoil.
weapons_desc.hunting_rifle: Typical high-caliber rifle, used for hunting large, dangerous animals.
weapons_desc.hyper_blaster: Rapid-fire blast weapon. Most models rely on three rotating barrels to deal with heat build-up.
weapons_desc.infantry_laser: Military energy rifle with detachable battery pack.
weapons_desc.machine_pistol: A compact, fully automatic firearm in pistol caliber.
weapons_desc.marksman_rifle: Military rifle, built for sharp shooting. Common platoon-level support weapon.
weapons_desc.military_rifle: Conventional military automatic rifle. Caseless ammunition is typical.
weapons_desc.needle_rifle: Uses magnetism to launch a hail of razor-sharp needles at a target.
weapons_desc.plasma_rifle: Heavy rifle firing a stream of blue-white energy bolts. Excellent all-round combat weapon, but expensive, and difficult to cool.
weapons_desc.power_claw: Heavy servo-boosted gauntlet that straps to the entire arm. Capable of punching through steel.
weapons_desc.rattle_gun: Conventional machine gun. Most Fringe models are outdated and somewhat kit-bashed. Typically belt-fed.
weapons_desc.ripper_sword: Short, chopping blade fitted with microscopic “teeth” for ripping and tearing. Popular with K’Erin marines.
weapons_desc.scrap_pistol: A pistol pieced together from scavenged parts. Common on the frontiers.
weapons_desc.shatter_axe: This bulky weapon discharges a blast of energy as it strikes. Originally intended for breach-and-clear operations.
weapons_desc.shell_gun: Stand-alone grenade launcher. Many of these are custom-built.
weapons_desc.shotgun: Smooth-bore weapon firing a hail of pellets. Common hunting and defensive weapon.
